brief.content-text:
The diagram depicts the Ethernet MAC address structure. The address is divided into two parts, the Organizational Unique Identifier (O U I) and vendor assigned portion (for NIC's and interfaces).

Organizational Unique Identifier (O U I):
- 24 bits
- 6 hex digits
- 00 60 2F
- Cisco

Vendor Assigned (NIC's, Interfaces)
- 24 bits
- 6 hex digits
- 3A 07 BC
- Particular device

Different ways of representing the MAC address include:
- 00-60-2F-3A-07-BC
- 00:60:2F:3A:07:BC
- 0060.2F3A.07BC
